messages.message:
hey team - wanted to share some updates here on usage of log4j in monitoring/elasticsearch -
• Monitoring images: all the images are golang based and do not use log4j. Out of precaution, we have scanned these images and confirmed that this vulnerability does not exist.
• Elasticsearch: while many of the customers use internal hosted ES instance/image - some customers receive ES image from us. We have gone ahead to apply recommended JVM option (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/23377) to disable the usage of log4j lookup to address . This can be done through update to the yaml. (At a later point,  we will rebuild our images using new base images from Elastic community which includes this change/updated version of log4j2.)
I also scanned recent builds of pdf-tservice and table-tservice and do not see them affected by this (believe we do not use log4j v2 there). @Hari @Heymian pls double check to be sure ..

@Varun Jain - let's share a blurb (once we also confirm table/pdf service) for customers like C1/Natwest who will likely need the yaml update for elasticsearch to avoid vulnerable behaviour.  We can say something along the following lines -

> IB has looked into the images shipped for the newly reported log4j vulnerability CVE-2021-44228 (https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/alert-cve-2021-44228.html?source=:em:eo:ie:cpo:::RC_WWMK210714P00017:SEV400208211) and see `Elasticsearch` image to be impacted. We will like to apply the included patch here to ensure that the vulnerability cannot be exploited. We are also awaiting elastic community on getting an updated image that does not include vulnerable component and will ship once available. Thanks

Thanks for the update and picking this up on the weekend @sudeep! Let us finalise this on Monday and I’ll help coordinate the customer reach out (FYI @Aimé @wadams). I will also socialise this on TAM-internal channel to make sure no other customer is affected.
@sudeep @Varun Jain GS is asking for a second update - is it fair to say no impact detected so far for them?
Should we write up general talking points for all current/prospective customers as well? We may get asked about this in the near future
We're working on putting together comms across ENG and CS to share across all customers by Monday EoD. @Karina we will share a detailed update with GS as part of that.
Sounds good. We can also open a SEV4 just for tracking/coordination purposes - might help with keeping things in one place.

opened up https://instabase.blameless.io/incidents/32/events

i have no idea how to use blameless but if anyone wants to help please do :slightly_smiling_face:
